I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Lan Jin  Lan was always responsive to my emails.

Instructor: Lan Jin  The nature of the class was such that I did not need a lot of interaction with Lan. She provided graded papers in a reasonable amount of time and the commentary (which was a combination of hers and the professor's) was useful.
Instructor: Lan Jin  Responded questions and e-mails promptly and was very organized regarding our assignments and providing us with feedback

Instructor: Lan Jin  Lan was supportive in organizing the logistics of the course. She made herself available to support the students. I would have liked to see more involvement from Lan in the class discussionsI'm sure she has good insights for the class!

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The main value of the course was the application of epidemiological methods to a variety of environmental health topics, which greatly enhanced my knowledge of the key methods of this domain. Suggested improvement would be updating the slides - many of the topics/slides had the feel of being a little bit stale. Perhaps examination of more emerging topics in environmental health could be used as an update or replacement.

Question 15. The course focuses heavily on analyzing environmental health studies. This turned out to be a very useful exercise, and I appreciate the insights I have now, but it wasn't emphasized in the course description. It would be helpful to know that going in!

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: A good overview of many areas of environmental health research with a strong focus on assessing appropriate methodology.
The disaster case study was a great exercise, and got me to dive deeply into an area I normally wouldn't have. I also liked the small class size, because it allowed for good discussions.
The diversity of topics involving different environmental conditions impacting human health, as well as the interaction with faculty in these specific areas
In-depth analysis and discussions of studies were great and very helpful. Class lectures were varied and I think the guest lecturers were good choices and knowledgeable in their respective areas.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Overall the class did a good job at catering to both F&ES students and Public Health students, but the lecture on cancer (given by a guest lecturer) was much too technical for a student with no public health background.
More interactive components during the lecture could be useful to incite participation and questioning

Discussion took up a lot of course time. I think there could be more lectures on more varied topics, possibly including water quality or implementation. The workload got very heavy towards the end of the semester. At one point there were two papers and a presentation due on the same dayit was a lot of work! More spacing of assignments would be helpful.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes, I appreciated that lectures and discussions took place each class and reinforced the material that we were reading.
N/A

The two were generally tied together well. A few times the lecture went over a paper that ended up being part of the discussion, and Michelle sort of stole the thunder from the discussion leaders. Maybe we could switch up the discussion papers so we can have fresh disucussions.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course was helpful to me to gain experience evaluating environmental health and toxicology literature. It was useful to provide an introduction to different areas of the field and give me more confidence in critiquing study designs and methodology for environmental health. I anticipate using these skills to evaluate pesticide toxicology reviews and literature during my career.
It is a useful course for linking public health and environmental studies, though I'd say the emphasis is more on public health (which is a good thing!).

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course to become more familiar with evaluating epidemiological and toxicological literature as well as for interest in the subject matter.
My adviser suggested that I take a class on environmental health to round out my curriculum, and I'm so glad that she did.
To learn more methods tying in environmental health observations and epidemiological methods used to find associations.
The course supplemented my academic interests on the outcome of stressors in human health, focusing on the environmental perspective
TO gain exposure to major issues in environmental health. To become knoweldable in the history of environmental health and important studies and study methods.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.
Yes, I really enjoyed the course.
Yes
Yes; the class provided a well-structured syllabus that focused on man-made and natural environmental factors that affect health, while also strengthening research analysis and comprehension
Yes!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Presenting on readings in a group was an effective way to evaluate the literature.
N/A
The assignments were easy to coordinate/split between group members, and accountability was also easy to ensure, which was a good part of the course's design.

The group presentations were an excellent opportunity to work with other students who had similar interests in topics of environmental health. It was an appropriate supplement to the lecture portion of the class.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I can only speak for students who don't have background in public health, in which case I'd say that the class provides a great overview on environmental health issues. It was not a particularly stressful class, and I feel like I got a lot out of it.

Be sure to keep up with the readings from week-to-week to ensure you get the most out of the course. Also, progressively log your notes as the course goes on to facilitate preparation for the exam. Also, rest your wrist before the final exam because there will be a lot of writing!
The course is useful and good particularly if you already have some understanding of basic epidemiology. Be ready for a heavy workload towards the end of the semester.
